location: 690 SOUTH SERVICE RD, STONEY CREEK, ON, L8E 5M5
overall_building_description: The structural design of the new boiler building at 690 South Service Rd, Stoney Creek, ON, is characterized by a robust steel frame system, utilizing W8x31 beams and columns fabricated from G40.21M-350W steel. The primary load path initiates from the roof structure, transferring loads through the steel beams to the columns, which are anchored to the foundation via base plates. These base plates, such as bp1000, are detailed with precise dimensions of 1"x14"x1'-2" and are fabricated from A36 steel, ensuring adequate load distribution and stability. The connection between columns and base plates is reinforced with gussets, enhancing the structural integrity and providing lateral stability against wind and seismic forces. The beam-to-column connections are meticulously detailed, with fasteners specified as 8x 13/16" Ã˜ bolts, ensuring secure load transfer and minimizing deflection under service loads. The lateral load-resisting system is augmented by strategically placed bracing elements, which are integral to maintaining the building's structural integrity under lateral forces. The bracing system is designed to work in tandem with the steel frame, providing a comprehensive solution to lateral stability. The assembly sequence for the structural components is critical, with the erection of columns and beams following a precise order to ensure stability during construction. Temporary bracing may be required during the erection phase to maintain alignment and prevent structural deformation. The fabrication of steel components adheres to stringent standards, with all plates conforming to CSA-G40.20/G40.21 M300W specifications, ensuring material consistency and performance. The installation of anchor rods, such as the ASTM F1554 specified 1" diameter rods, is crucial for the secure attachment of columns to the foundation. These rods are embedded with a minimum projection of 6", as detailed in the column/anchor arrangement plans. The integration of chemical anchors, specifically Hilti HVU2 anchor capsules with HAS-V-36 rods, provides additional anchorage strength, with a typical embedment depth of 7". The detailing of angle components, such as L3X3X1/4 angles with G40.21M-300W specification, is essential for the connection of secondary structural elements, with precise hole placements and dimensions ensuring accurate assembly. The project adheres to relevant building codes and standards, with design criteria focused on achieving optimal performance under anticipated load conditions. The structural design incorporates considerations for environmental factors, ensuring durability and resilience in the face of potential climatic challenges. The use of high-strength steel and precise fabrication techniques underscores the project's commitment to safety and longevity, with all components designed to meet or exceed industry standards for industrial building construction.
